intro: Sonchus hotha, commonly known as Hotha sowthistle, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, often with a distinctive white or pale green center. Hotha sowthistle is often found in disturbed soils and can be invasive in certain regions.
